intro: Saussurea mutabilis, commonly known as the variable saffron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, with a fuzzy texture. The flowers bloom in late summer and are known for their delicate, daisy-like appearance.
